[[File:Stefano Baldo - Palantír of Elostirion.jpg|frame|''Palantír of Elostirion'' from [[Middle-earth Collectible Card Game|MECCG]]]]

'''Elendil's Stone''',<ref>{{TT|Palantir}}, p. 598</ref> the '''Elendil Stone''',<ref>{{UT|14a}}, ''Note 16'', pp. 413-4</ref> or the '''Stone of Elendil''',<ref name=Varda>{{RGEO|Notes}}, pp. 65-6</ref> was one of the ''[[palantíri]]'' brought by the [[Faithful]] from [[Númenor]] to [[Middle-earth]].<ref name=Rings>{{S|Rings}}</ref>

The stone was aligned westwards towards the [[Master-stone]] in the [[Tower of Avallonë]], along the length of the [[Straight Road]]; because of this, it could not communicate with the other six of [[Middle-earth]]. Elendil was able to use it to look west across the [[Belegaer|Sea]] and see the [[Undying Lands]];<ref name=Rings/> but he could not see Númenor for it was covered by the bent seas for ever.<ref name=App>{{App|Eriador}}, ''The North-kingdom and the Dúnedain'', entry for King Arvedue, footnote about the ''palantíri'', p. 1042</ref>

It was stored in the tower of [[Elostirion]] in the [[Emyn Beraid]], and after [[Elendil]]'s death the [[Calaquendi|High Elves]] took it under their care and no [[Men|Man]] used it again.<ref name=Varda/>

Even after the fall of [[Arnor]], [[Wandering Companies]] of High Elves made pilgrimages to visit the Towers and see the Stone, in order to look at [[Tol Eressëa]] and the Shores of Valinor and sometimes to be rewarded by a vision of [[Varda]] standing on the mountain [[Oiolossë]].<ref name=Varda/> One such company, led by [[Gildor|Gildor Inglorion]], just returning from Elostirion,<ref name=Varda/> was encountered by [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] on [[24 September|September 24]], {{TA|3018}}.<ref>{{FR|Three}}, pp. 78-80</ref>

It remained in its tower until the end of the [[Third Age]]; it was then removed by [[Círdan]], placed on the [[White Ship]] and taken back into the West.<ref name=App/>
